title: Machine Learning - MODERATE Level
description: ‚öôÔ∏è Sharpen your model skills! This quiz explores $\mathbf{model \, evaluation}$ üìê, $\text{optimization \, algorithms}$ üìâ, $\text{ensemble \, methods}$ üå≥, and the critical **Bias-Variance Tradeoff** $\mathbf{B-V}$. (20 Questions - 40 Minutes)

questions.text: The $\mathbf{Bias-Variance \, Tradeoff}$ aims to balance the errors due to underfitting (high bias) and what other factor?
Which optimization algorithm is used to find the minimum of a function by iteratively moving in the direction of the steepest descent?
What does the $\mathbf{F1 \, Score}$ represent?

options.b: Harmonic mean of Precision and Recall
options.c: Geometric mean of Precision and Recall
options.d: Difference between True Positives and False Positives

questions.text: Which technique combines predictions from multiple Decision Trees to improve robustness and reduce overfitting?
The process of scaling features to have zero mean and unit variance is called $\mathbf{Z-Score}$ or...
Which loss function is commonly used for **classification** tasks involving probabilities (like in Logistic Regression)?
In $\mathbf{Support \, Vector \, Machines \, (SVM)}$, the $\mathbf{Kernel \, Trick}$ is used to effectively classify data that is...

options.b: Non-linearly separable in the input space

questions.text: The $\mathbf{Learning \, Rate}$ in Gradient Descent determines the size of the...

options.c: Step taken towards the minimum of the loss function

questions.text: What does $\mathbf{PCA \, (Principal \, Component \, Analysis)}$ primarily achieve?
The $\mathbf{ROC \, curve \, (Receiver \, Operating \, Characteristic)}$ plots which two metrics against each other?

options.c: True Positive Rate (Sensitivity) and False Positive Rate (1-Specificity)

questions.text: Which technique is used to prevent overfitting by adding a penalty term to the loss function based on the magnitude of the model's weights?
The $\mathbf{hyperparameter}$ $\mathbf{k}$ in the $\text{K-Means \, algorithm}$ represents the number of...
In $\mathbf{Ensemble \, Learning}$, **Bagging** (Bootstrap Aggregating) aims to reduce which type of error?
What is the primary characteristic of $\mathbf{Stochastic \, Gradient \, Descent \, (SGD)}$?

options.a: Uses the entire dataset for each update
options.b: Uses only one training example (or small batch) for each update
options.d: Does not use a loss function

questions.text: The $\mathbf{Cross-Validation}$ technique used to ensure all samples are used for both training and validation exactly once is called...
The problem of **vanishing gradients** occurs primarily in which type of model?
What does the $\mathbf{p}$-value in $\mathbf{Statistical \, Modeling}$ indicate?

options.b: The probability that the observed result occurred by chance

questions.text: Which measure is used to evaluate the error for a **regression** model and is sensitive to large errors/outliers?
In the $\mathbf{K-Nearest \, Neighbors \, (KNN)}$ algorithm, what distance metric is most commonly used?

The $\mathbf{Bootstrap \, samples}$ used in Random Forest are created by sampling the original data $\mathbf{with \, replacement}$. This results in some data points being repeated and some left out (out-of-bag).
